title: 11 Outdoor Bar Carts To Roll Into Summer With Style 2025
description: Alfresco Aperol spritzes and poolside margaritas await
author: Blake Bakkila
excerpt: Alfresco Aperol spritzes and poolside margaritas await with these dreamy picks from Blu Dot, Knoll, Amazon, and more.
text: With summer comes endless opportunities for alfresco get-togethers and moonlit dinner soirees—a.k.a. the perfect excuse to level up your hosting with the best outdoor bar carts. Whether your plans for the season involve lounging poolside or simply spending more time socializing on your newly furnished patio, outdoor bar carts are ready to roll for an at-home happy hour at impromptu times.Each bar cart on our list has its own personality, with some featuring four or two wheels (a nod to their Victorian-era tea trolley roots). Rattan and powder-coated aluminum are popular within the category, which includes space-saving designs and even some carts that function as a mobile kitchen island or storage cabinets. After evaluating your home’s overall look and feel, and factoring in the size of your outdoor space, you’re bound to find the best bonus bar for summertime hosting. Read on for our trending favorites from today’s top outdoor furniture retailers.Our top picks for the best outdoor bar cartsBest coastal feel: Serena & Lily Captiva Bar Car, $1,298 $1,038Modern farmhouse must-have: Pottery Barn Saratoga Outdoor Bar Cart, $499 $399Best rounded shape: Lulu and Georgia Annika Indoor/Outdoor Bar Cart, $849Mixed-media design: Article Boden Outdoor Bar Cart, $449For vintage flair: Business & Pleasure Co. Al Fresco Bar Cart, $1,498Best bar cart cooler: Permasteel Portable Rolling Patio Cooler, $200Serena & Lily Captiva Bar CartIf you’re situated seaside or have a coastal theme running throughout your outdoor space, virtually anything from Serena & Lily will complement your space. We’re partial to the Captiva Bar Cart, an indoor/outdoor option made with weatherproof resin wicker. Adorn it with the brand’s seagrass-accented wine glasses or handwoven rattan cocktail tools to mimic happy hour at a tropical resort.Dimensions: 41"W x 16"D x 35.75"HPottery Barn Saratoga Outdoor Bar CartWeathered wood and clean lines work together for a slightly rustic approach to a modern bar cart. Made with 100% eucalyptus wood, you can place glassware on the tray top and display your most aesthetically pleasing liquor bottles or fresh greenery on the lower shelf.Dimensions: 35"W x 17"D x 32"HLulu and Georgia Annika Indoor/Outdoor Bar CartDeviating from the classic rectilinear bar cart frame, Lulu and Georgia’s rounded alternative is crafted from weather-resistant teak with a tempered glass top. Over time, the finish will transition into a more weathered gray patina, which is something to consider as you’re furnishing your outdoor patio or terrace. It could also double as a side table next to an outdoor sectional or even in the corner of a living room. Pro tip: To weatherproof your teak, treat it with teak oil or sealer.Dimensions: 22"W x 23"D x 36"HArticle Boden Bar CartArticle is home to an affordably priced selection of Scandi-inclined pieces—this outdoor bar cart being a standout. The matte gray powder-coated frame is made more charming with the subtle addition of the teak handle—ideal for a midcentury-modern-minded outdoor space.Dimensions: 31"W x 19.5"D x 32.5"HKnoll 1966 Porcelain Serving Cart by Richard SchultzKnoll’s splurge worthy bar cart would look sleek perched poolside and holding a pitcher of sangria. A prized piece for any Knoll collector, the timeless silhouette is part of the wider 1966 collection which was designed the year of its namesake. You can accessorize it with the matching lounge chair and coffee table to create a full-on Knoll moment in your backyard.Dimensions: 26¼" H 23½" W 39" DBusiness & Pleasure Co. Al Fresco Bar CartThis vintage-inspired outdoor serving cart is anything but grandma. Scalloped edges give the piece a whimsical feel, while the sturdy steel frame grounds it with practical durability. We’d also be remiss not to mention there’s a hole included in the design, perfect for pairing with one of the brand’s signature patio umbrellas. Add a chaise lounge on either side and you’ll have a tough time leaving this spot.Dimensions: 39"W x 20"D x 36"HCrate & Barrel Abaco Outdoor Bar CartThere’s a lot to love about this acacia wood bar cart, which has a smaller profile to display on balconies or patios with minimal square footage. Leave your wine bottles on ice in the metal-lined wicker ice bucket and arrange a cheeseboard on the concrete-resin block for the perfect outdoor entertaining moment.Dimensions: 33.88"W x 20"D x 29"HBlu Dot Longday Bar CartThis Scandi-influenced bar cart looks like it was pulled right out of a Slim Aarons dreamscape. The white aluminum frame and teak accents (including a convenient cutting board!) are ready for your next Palm Springs pool day.Dimensions: 33"W x 21"D x 34"HAllModern Terrace Solid Wood Bar CartThis wood-slatted option is proof that you don’t have to spend hundreds on an actually attractive serving cart (meaning you can invest in some really nice bar equipment). It has weathered staining to coordinate with the existing outdoor decor on a beach house deck, cottage garden terrace, or even your beloved Adirondack chairs.Dimensions: 48"W x 20"D x 31.9"HPermasteel Portable Rolling Patio CoolerThis portable ice chest is the pop of color your contemporary outdoor space needs. I have this on display on my concrete-paved patio in Southern California, and I’m pleased to report it’s held up well over the past two years (with only a few signs of rust near the hardware). Plus there’s no need to play bartender, thanks to the attached bottle opener on the side.Dimensions: 35.5"W x 19.25"D x 34"HYITAHOME Outdoor Wicker Rolling Bar TableTake your backyard BBQs to the next level with an outdoor bar table that will make prep a breeze. Unlike its rattan counterparts, this all-weather wicker bar cart will last for years, plus it has enclosed compartments to stash beach towels, grill tools, wine racks, glassware, or for any extra outdoor storage.Dimensions: 51.2"W x 19.7"D x 35.4"H
html:
With summer comes endless opportunities for alfresco get-togethers and moonlit dinner soirees—a.k.a. the perfect excuse to level up your hosting with the best outdoor bar carts. Whether your plans for the season involve lounging poolside or simply spending more time socializing on your newly furnished patio, outdoor bar carts are ready to roll for an at-home happy hour at impromptu times.

Each bar cart on our list has its own personality, with some featuring four or two wheels (a nod to their Victorian-era tea trolley roots). Rattan and powder-coated aluminum are popular within the category, which includes space-saving designs and even some carts that function as a mobile kitchen island or storage cabinets. After evaluating your home’s overall look and feel, and factoring in the size of your outdoor space, you’re bound to find the best bonus bar for summertime hosting. Read on for our trending favorites from today’s top outdoor furniture retailers.

Our top picks for the best outdoor bar carts

  • Best coastal feel: Serena & Lily Captiva Bar Car, $1,298 $1,038
  • Modern farmhouse must-have: Pottery Barn Saratoga Outdoor Bar Cart, $499 $399
  • Best rounded shape: Lulu and Georgia Annika Indoor/Outdoor Bar Cart, $849
  • Mixed-media design: Article Boden Outdoor Bar Cart, $449
  • For vintage flair: Business & Pleasure Co. Al Fresco Bar Cart, $1,498
  • Best bar cart cooler: Permasteel Portable Rolling Patio Cooler, $200

Serena & Lily Captiva Bar Cart

If you’re situated seaside or have a coastal theme running throughout your outdoor space, virtually anything from Serena & Lily will complement your space. We’re partial to the Captiva Bar Cart, an indoor/outdoor option made with weatherproof resin wicker. Adorn it with the brand’s seagrass-accented wine glasses or handwoven rattan cocktail tools to mimic happy hour at a tropical resort.

Dimensions: 41"W x 16"D x 35.75"H

Pottery Barn Saratoga Outdoor Bar Cart

Weathered wood and clean lines work together for a slightly rustic approach to a modern bar cart. Made with 100% eucalyptus wood, you can place glassware on the tray top and display your most aesthetically pleasing liquor bottles or fresh greenery on the lower shelf.

Dimensions: 35"W x 17"D x 32"H

Lulu and Georgia Annika Indoor/Outdoor Bar Cart

Deviating from the classic rectilinear bar cart frame, Lulu and Georgia’s rounded alternative is crafted from weather-resistant teak with a tempered glass top. Over time, the finish will transition into a more weathered gray patina, which is something to consider as you’re furnishing your outdoor patio or terrace. It could also double as a side table next to an outdoor sectional or even in the corner of a living room. Pro tip: To weatherproof your teak, treat it with teak oil or sealer.

Dimensions: 22"W x 23"D x 36"H

Article Boden Bar Cart

Article is home to an affordably priced selection of Scandi-inclined pieces—this outdoor bar cart being a standout. The matte gray powder-coated frame is made more charming with the subtle addition of the teak handle—ideal for a midcentury-modern-minded outdoor space.

Dimensions: 31"W x 19.5"D x 32.5"H

Knoll 1966 Porcelain Serving Cart by Richard Schultz

Knoll’s splurge worthy bar cart would look sleek perched poolside and holding a pitcher of sangria. A prized piece for any Knoll collector, the timeless silhouette is part of the wider 1966 collection which was designed the year of its namesake. You can accessorize it with the matching lounge chair and coffee table to create a full-on Knoll moment in your backyard.

Dimensions: 26¼" H 23½" W 39" D

Business & Pleasure Co. Al Fresco Bar Cart

This vintage-inspired outdoor serving cart is anything but grandma. Scalloped edges give the piece a whimsical feel, while the sturdy steel frame grounds it with practical durability. We’d also be remiss not to mention there’s a hole included in the design, perfect for pairing with one of the brand’s signature patio umbrellas. Add a chaise lounge on either side and you’ll have a tough time leaving this spot.

Dimensions: 39"W x 20"D x 36"H

Crate & Barrel Abaco Outdoor Bar Cart

There’s a lot to love about this acacia wood bar cart, which has a smaller profile to display on balconies or patios with minimal square footage. Leave your wine bottles on ice in the metal-lined wicker ice bucket and arrange a cheeseboard on the concrete-resin block for the perfect outdoor entertaining moment.

Dimensions: 33.88"W x 20"D x 29"H

Blu Dot Longday Bar Cart

This Scandi-influenced bar cart looks like it was pulled right out of a Slim Aarons dreamscape. The white aluminum frame and teak accents (including a convenient cutting board!) are ready for your next Palm Springs pool day.

Dimensions: 33"W x 21"D x 34"H

AllModern Terrace Solid Wood Bar Cart

This wood-slatted option is proof that you don’t have to spend hundreds on an actually attractive serving cart (meaning you can invest in some really nice bar equipment). It has weathered staining to coordinate with the existing outdoor decor on a beach house deck, cottage garden terrace, or even your beloved Adirondack chairs.

Dimensions: 48"W x 20"D x 31.9"H

Permasteel Portable Rolling Patio Cooler

This portable ice chest is the pop of color your contemporary outdoor space needs. I have this on display on my concrete-paved patio in Southern California, and I’m pleased to report it’s held up well over the past two years (with only a few signs of rust near the hardware). Plus there’s no need to play bartender, thanks to the attached bottle opener on the side.

Dimensions: 35.5"W x 19.25"D x 34"H

YITAHOME Outdoor Wicker Rolling Bar Table

Take your backyard BBQs to the next level with an outdoor bar table that will make prep a breeze. Unlike its rattan counterparts, this all-weather wicker bar cart will last for years, plus it has enclosed compartments to stash beach towels, grill tools, wine racks, glassware, or for any extra outdoor storage.

Dimensions: 51.2"W x 19.7"D x 35.4"H
